Problem:
Consider a function \\( z(t) \\) described by the complex differential equation \\( z'(t) = iz(t) \\), where \\( i \\) is the imaginary unit. The impact of an integral transformation \\( T[f](s) = \\int_0^\\infty e^{-st} f(t) dt \\) applied to \\( z(t) \\) is considered.

If an additional transformation \\( U[f](s) = \\int_0^\\infty e^{-st^2} f(t) dt \\) is applied as an intervention at time \\( t_1 > 0 \\), will the result of \\( T[z](s) \\) at t = T completely ignore the intervention by U?
Explanation: The intervention with \\( U \\) modifies the system, altering the behavior of \\( z(t) \\), and consequently the integral transformation \\( T \\) at any time later than \\( t_1 \\) will reflect this change, integrating a different function affected by U.
